blocks.name: df-redunds
blocks.content: Define the class of all redundant sets ` x ` with respect to ` y ` in ` z ` . For sets, binary relation on the class of all redundant sets ( ~ brredunds ) is equivalent to satisfying the redundancy predicate ( ~ df-redund ). (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 23-Oct-2022.)

blocks.name: df-redund
blocks.content: Define the redundancy predicate. Read: ` A ` is redundant with respect to ` B ` in ` C ` . For sets, binary relation on the class of all redundant sets ( ~ brredunds ) is equivalent to satisfying the redundancy predicate. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 23-Oct-2022.)

blocks.name: df-redundp
blocks.content: Define the redundancy operator for propositions, cf. ~ df-redund . (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 23-Oct-2022.)

blocks.name: brredunds
blocks.content: Binary relation on the class of all redundant sets. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 25-Oct-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm brredunds(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, c1), wcel(c2, c3), wcel(c4, c5)), wb(wbr(c0, credunds, cop(c2, c4)), wa(wss(c0, c2), wceq(cin(c0, c4), cin(c2, c4)))))
} = {
  brcnvrabga(hs0, hs1, hs2, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, credunds, wa(wss(c0, c2), wceq(cin(c0, c4), cin(c2, c4))), wa(wss(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wceq(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cin(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)))))
  anbi12d(w3a(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2), wceq(cv(hs2), c4)), wss(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wceq(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cin(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))), wss(c0, c2), wceq(cin(c0, c4), cin(c2, c4)))
  3adant3(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2), wceq(cv(hs2), c4), wb(wss(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wss(c0, c2)))
  sseq12(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs1), c2)
  eqeq12d(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cin(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)), cin(c0, c4), cin(c2, c4), w3a(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2), wceq(cv(hs2), c4)))
  3adant2(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2), wceq(cv(hs2), c4), wceq(cin(cv(hs0), cv(hs2)), cin(c0, c4)))
  ineq12(cv(hs0), c0, cv(hs2), c4)
  3adant1(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wceq(cv(hs1), c2), wceq(cv(hs2), c4), wceq(cin(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)), cin(c2, c4)))
  ineq12(cv(hs1), c2, cv(hs2), c4)
  df-redunds(hs1, hs2, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c4)
  diff.hs2.c(c0)
  diff.hs2.c(c2)
  diff.hs2.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wss(c0, c2), wceq(cin(c0, c4), cin(c2, c4))))
  diff.hs1.w(wa(wss(c0, c2), wceq(cin(c0, c4), cin(c2, c4))))
  diff.hs2.w(wa(wss(c0, c2), wceq(cin(c0, c4), cin(c2, c4))))
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs2.s(hs0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm brredunds(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ c1 ∧ c2 ∈ c3 ∧ c4 ∈ c5)→(c0[Redunds]< c2, c4 > ↔(c0 ⊆ c2 ∧(c0 ⋂ c4)=(c2 ⋂ c4))))
} = {
  brcnvrabga(hs0, hs1, hs2, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4, c5, credunds, (c0 ⊆ c2 ∧(c0 ⋂ c4)=(c2 ⋂ c4)), (hs0 ⊆ hs1 ∧(hs0 ⋂ hs2)=(hs1 ⋂ hs2)))
  anbi12d((hs0 = c0 ∧ hs1 = c2 ∧ hs2 = c4), hs0 ⊆ hs1, (hs0 ⋂ hs2)=(hs1 ⋂ hs2), c0 ⊆ c2, (c0 ⋂ c4)=(c2 ⋂ c4))
  3adant3(hs0 = c0, hs1 = c2, hs2 = c4, (hs0 ⊆ hs1 ↔ c0 ⊆ c2))
  sseq12(hs0, c0, hs1, c2)
  eqeq12d((hs0 ⋂ hs2), (hs1 ⋂ hs2), (c0 ⋂ c4), (c2 ⋂ c4), (hs0 = c0 ∧ hs1 = c2 ∧ hs2 = c4))
  3adant2(hs0 = c0, hs1 = c2, hs2 = c4, (hs0 ⋂ hs2)=(c0 ⋂ c4))
  ineq12(hs0, c0, hs2, c4)
  3adant1(hs0 = c0, hs1 = c2, hs2 = c4, (hs1 ⋂ hs2)=(c2 ⋂ c4))
  ineq12(hs1, c2, hs2, c4)
  df-redunds(hs1, hs2, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.c(c4)
  diff.hs2.c(c0)
  diff.hs2.c(c2)
  diff.hs2.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.w((c0 ⊆ c2 ∧(c0 ⋂ c4)=(c2 ⋂ c4)))
  diff.hs1.w((c0 ⊆ c2 ∧(c0 ⋂ c4)=(c2 ⋂ c4)))
  diff.hs2.w((c0 ⊆ c2 ∧(c0 ⋂ c4)=(c2 ⋂ c4)))
  diff.hs1.s(hs0)
  diff.hs2.s(hs0)
}

blocks.name: brredundsredund
blocks.content: For sets, binary relation on the class of all redundant sets ( ~ brredunds ) is equivalent to satisfying the redundancy predicate ( ~ df-redund ). (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 25-Oct-2022.)

blocks.name: redundss3
blocks.content: Implication of redundancy predicate. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 26-Oct-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm redundss3(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wredund(c0, c1, c2), wredund(c0, c1, c3))
  -| wss(c3, c2)
} = {
  3imtr4i(wredund(c0, c1, c2), wredund(c0, c1, c3), wa(wss(c0, c1), wceq(cin(c0, c2), cin(c1, c2))), wa(wss(c0, c1), wceq(cin(c0, c3), cin(c1, c3))))
  anim2i(wss(c0, c1), wceq(cin(c0, c2), cin(c1, c2)), wceq(cin(c0, c3), cin(c1, c3)))
  3eqtr4g(cin(c0, c3), cin(c1, c3), cin(cin(c0, c2), c3), cin(cin(c1, c2), c3), wceq(cin(c0, c2), cin(c1, c2)))
  ineq1(cin(c0, c2), cin(c1, c2), c3)
  eqtr4i(cin(c0, c3), cin(cin(c0, c2), c3), cin(c0, cin(c2, c3)))
  ineq2i(c0, c3, cin(c2, c3))
  inass(c0, c2, c3)
  eqtr4i(cin(c1, c3), cin(cin(c1, c2), c3), cin(c1, cin(c2, c3)))
  ineq2i(c1, c3, cin(c2, c3))
  eqtri(c3, cin(c2, c3), cin(c3, c2))
  mpbi(wceq(c3, cin(c3, c2)), wss(c3, c2))
  dfss(c3, c2)
  incom(c3, c2)
  inass(c1, c2, c3)
  df-redund(c0, c1, c2)
  df-redund(c0, c1, c3)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm redundss3(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ (Redund(c0, < c1, c2 >)→ Redund(c0, < c1, c3 >))
  ⊣ c3 ⊆ c2
} = {
  3imtr4i(Redund(c0, < c1, c2 >), Redund(c0, < c1, c3 >), (c0 ⊆ c1 ∧(c0 ⋂ c2)=(c1 ⋂ c2)), (c0 ⊆ c1 ∧(c0 ⋂ c3)=(c1 ⋂ c3)))
  anim2i(c0 ⊆ c1, (c0 ⋂ c2)=(c1 ⋂ c2), (c0 ⋂ c3)=(c1 ⋂ c3))
  3eqtr4g((c0 ⋂ c3), (c1 ⋂ c3), ((c0 ⋂ c2)⋂ c3), ((c1 ⋂ c2)⋂ c3), (c0 ⋂ c2)=(c1 ⋂ c2))
  ineq1((c0 ⋂ c2), (c1 ⋂ c2), c3)
  eqtr4i((c0 ⋂ c3), ((c0 ⋂ c2)⋂ c3), (c0 ⋂(c2 ⋂ c3)))
  ineq2i(c0, c3, (c2 ⋂ c3))
  inass(c0, c2, c3)
  eqtr4i((c1 ⋂ c3), ((c1 ⋂ c2)⋂ c3), (c1 ⋂(c2 ⋂ c3)))
  ineq2i(c1, c3, (c2 ⋂ c3))
  eqtri(c3, (c2 ⋂ c3), (c3 ⋂ c2))
  mpbi(c3 =(c3 ⋂ c2), c3 ⊆ c2)
  dfss(c3, c2)
  incom(c3, c2)
  inass(c1, c2, c3)
  df-redund(c0, c1, c2)
  df-redund(c0, c1, c3)
}

blocks.name: redundeq1
blocks.content: Equivalence of redundancy predicates. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 26-Oct-2022.)

blocks.name: redundpim3
blocks.content: Implication of redundancy of proposition. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 26-Oct-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm redundpim3(wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3) {
  |- wi(wredundp(w0, w1, w2), wredundp(w0, w1, w3))
  -| wi(w3, w2)
} = {
  3imtr4i(wredundp(w0, w1, w2), wredundp(w0, w1, w3), wa(wi(w0, w1), wb(wa(w0, w2), wa(w1, w2))), wa(wi(w0, w1), wb(wa(w0, w3), wa(w1, w3))))
  anim2i(wi(w0, w1), wb(wa(w0, w2), wa(w1, w2)), wb(wa(w0, w3), wa(w1, w3)))
  3bitr4g(wb(wa(w0, w2), wa(w1, w2)), wa(w0, w3), wa(w1, w3), wa(wa(w0, w2), w3), wa(wa(w1, w2), w3))
  anbi1(wa(w0, w2), wa(w1, w2), w3)
  bianass(w0, w3, w2, w3)
  bianass(w1, w3, w2, w3)
  pm4.71ri(w3, w2)
  df-redundp(w0, w1, w2)
  df-redundp(w0, w1, w3)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm redundpim3(wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3) {
  ⊢ (redund(w0, w1, w2)→ redund(w0, w1, w3))
  ⊣ (w3 → w2)
} = {
  3imtr4i(redund(w0, w1, w2), redund(w0, w1, w3), ((w0 → w1)∧((w0 ∧ w2)↔(w1 ∧ w2))), ((w0 → w1)∧((w0 ∧ w3)↔(w1 ∧ w3))))
  anim2i((w0 → w1), ((w0 ∧ w2)↔(w1 ∧ w2)), ((w0 ∧ w3)↔(w1 ∧ w3)))
  3bitr4g(((w0 ∧ w2)↔(w1 ∧ w2)), (w0 ∧ w3), (w1 ∧ w3), ((w0 ∧ w2)∧ w3), ((w1 ∧ w2)∧ w3))
  anbi1((w0 ∧ w2), (w1 ∧ w2), w3)
  bianass(w0, w3, w2, w3)
  bianass(w1, w3, w2, w3)
  pm4.71ri(w3, w2)
  df-redundp(w0, w1, w2)
  df-redundp(w0, w1, w3)
}

blocks.name: redundpbi1
blocks.content: Equivalence of redundancy of propositions. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 25-Oct-2022.)

blocks.name: refrelsredund4
blocks.content: The naive version of the class of reflexive relations is redundant with respect to the class of reflexive relations (see ~ dfrefrels2 ) if the relations are symmetric as well. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 26-Oct-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm refrelsredund4(setvar s0) {
  |- wredund(crab(s0, crels, wss(cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0))), crefrels, cin(crefrels, csymrels))
} = {
  mpbir2an(wredund(crab(s0, crels, wss(cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0))), crefrels, cin(crefrels, csymrels)), wss(crab(s0, crels, wss(cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0))), crefrels), wceq(cin(crab(s0, crels, wss(cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0))), cin(crefrels, csymrels)), cin(crefrels, cin(crefrels, csymrels))))
  sseqtr4i(crab(s0, crels, wss(cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0))), crefrels, crab(s0, crels, wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cv(s0))))
  ssrabi(s0, crels, wss(cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0)), wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cv(s0)))
  ax-mp(wi(wss(cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0)), wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cv(s0))), wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0)))))
  inxpssres(cid, cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))
  sstr2(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(cv(s0)), crn(cv(s0)))), cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0))
  dfrefrels2(s0)
  3eqtri(cin(crab(s0, crels, wss(cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0))), cin(crefrels, csymrels)), cin(crefrels, cin(crefrels, csymrels)), cin(cin(crefrels, csymrels), crefrels), cin(cin(crefrels, crefrels), csymrels))
  3eqtr3ri(cin(crab(s0, crels, wss(cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0))), cin(crefrels, csymrels)), cin(cin(crefrels, csymrels), crefrels), cin(cin(crab(s0, crels, wss(cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0))), csymrels), crefrels), cin(cin(crab(s0, crels, wss(cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0))), crefrels), csymrels))
  in32(crab(s0, crels, wss(cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0))), csymrels, crefrels)
  ineq1i(cin(crab(s0, crels, wss(cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0))), csymrels), crefrels, cin(crefrels, csymrels))
  3eqtr4i(cin(crab(s0, crels, wss(cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0))), csymrels), cin(crefrels, csymrels), cin(crab(s0, crels, wss(cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0))), crab(s0, crels, wss(ccnv(cv(s0)), cv(s0)))), crab(s0, crels, wa(wss(cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0)), wss(ccnv(cv(s0)), cv(s0)))))
  inrab(s0, crels, wss(cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0)), wss(ccnv(cv(s0)), cv(s0)))
  ineq2i(crab(s0, crels, wss(cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0))), csymrels, crab(s0, crels, wss(ccnv(cv(s0)), cv(s0))))
  dfsymrels2(s0)
  refsymrels2(s0)
  inass(crab(s0, crels, wss(cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0))), crefrels, csymrels)
  in32(crefrels, csymrels, crefrels)
  inass(crefrels, crefrels, csymrels)
  df-redund(crab(s0, crels, wss(cres(cid, cdm(cv(s0))), cv(s0))), crefrels, cin(crefrels, csymrels))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm refrelsredund4(setvar s0) {
  ⊢ Redund({ s0 ∈ Rels |(= |` dom(s0))⊆ s0 }, < RefRels,(RefRels ⋂ SymRels)>)
} = {
  mpbir2an(Redund({ s0 ∈ Rels |(= |` dom(s0))⊆ s0 }, < RefRels,(RefRels ⋂ SymRels)>), { s0 ∈ Rels |(= |` dom(s0))⊆ s0 } ⊆ RefRels, ({ s0 ∈ Rels |(= |` dom(s0))⊆ s0 } ⋂(RefRels ⋂ SymRels))=(RefRels ⋂(RefRels ⋂ SymRels)))
  sseqtr4i({ s0 ∈ Rels |(= |` dom(s0))⊆ s0 }, crefrels, { s0 ∈ Rels |(= ⋂(dom(s0)× ran(s0)))⊆ s0 })
  ssrabi(s0, crels, (= |` dom(s0))⊆ s0, (= ⋂(dom(s0)× ran(s0)))⊆ s0)
  ax-mp(((= |` dom(s0))⊆ s0 →(= ⋂(dom(s0)× ran(s0)))⊆ s0), (= ⋂(dom(s0)× ran(s0)))⊆(= |` dom(s0)))
  inxpssres(cid, dom(s0), ran(s0))
  sstr2((= ⋂(dom(s0)× ran(s0))), (= |` dom(s0)), s0)
  dfrefrels2(s0)
  3eqtri(({ s0 ∈ Rels |(= |` dom(s0))⊆ s0 } ⋂(RefRels ⋂ SymRels)), (RefRels ⋂(RefRels ⋂ SymRels)), ((RefRels ⋂ SymRels)⋂ RefRels), ((RefRels ⋂ RefRels)⋂ SymRels))
  3eqtr3ri(({ s0 ∈ Rels |(= |` dom(s0))⊆ s0 } ⋂(RefRels ⋂ SymRels)), ((RefRels ⋂ SymRels)⋂ RefRels), (({ s0 ∈ Rels |(= |` dom(s0))⊆ s0 } ⋂ SymRels)⋂ RefRels), (({ s0 ∈ Rels |(= |` dom(s0))⊆ s0 } ⋂ RefRels)⋂ SymRels))
  in32({ s0 ∈ Rels |(= |` dom(s0))⊆ s0 }, csymrels, crefrels)
  ineq1i(({ s0 ∈ Rels |(= |` dom(s0))⊆ s0 } ⋂ SymRels), crefrels, (RefRels ⋂ SymRels))
  3eqtr4i(({ s0 ∈ Rels |(= |` dom(s0))⊆ s0 } ⋂ SymRels), (RefRels ⋂ SymRels), ({ s0 ∈ Rels |(= |` dom(s0))⊆ s0 } ⋂ { s0 ∈ Rels | `' s0 ⊆ s0 }), { s0 ∈ Rels |((= |` dom(s0))⊆ s0 ∧ `' s0 ⊆ s0)})
  inrab(s0, crels, (= |` dom(s0))⊆ s0, `' s0 ⊆ s0)
  ineq2i({ s0 ∈ Rels |(= |` dom(s0))⊆ s0 }, csymrels, { s0 ∈ Rels | `' s0 ⊆ s0 })
  dfsymrels2(s0)
  refsymrels2(s0)
  inass({ s0 ∈ Rels |(= |` dom(s0))⊆ s0 }, crefrels, csymrels)
  in32(crefrels, csymrels, crefrels)
  inass(crefrels, crefrels, csymrels)
  df-redund({ s0 ∈ Rels |(= |` dom(s0))⊆ s0 }, crefrels, (RefRels ⋂ SymRels))
}

blocks.name: refrelsredund2
blocks.content: The naive version of the class of reflexive relations is redundant with respect to the class of reflexive relations (see ~ dfrefrels2 ) in the class of equivalence relations. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 26-Oct-2022.)

blocks.name: refrelsredund3
blocks.content: The naive version of the class of reflexive relations ` { r e. Rels | A. x e. dom r x r x } ` is redundant with respect to the class of reflexive relations (see ~ dfrefrels3 ) in the class of equivalence relations. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 26-Oct-2022.)

blocks.name: refrelredund4
blocks.content: The naive version of the definition of reflexive relation is redundant with respect to reflexive relation (see ~ dfrefrel2 ) if the relation is symmetric as well. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 26-Oct-2022.)
blocks.origin:
thm refrelredund4(class c0) {
  |- wredundp(wa(wss(cres(cid, cdm(c0)), c0), wrel(c0)), wrefrel(c0), wa(wrefrel(c0), wsymrel(c0)))
} = {
  mpbir2an(wredundp(wa(wss(cres(cid, cdm(c0)), c0), wrel(c0)), wrefrel(c0), wa(wrefrel(c0), wsymrel(c0))), wi(wa(wss(cres(cid, cdm(c0)), c0), wrel(c0)), wrefrel(c0)), wb(wa(wa(wss(cres(cid, cdm(c0)), c0), wrel(c0)), wa(wrefrel(c0), wsymrel(c0))), wa(wrefrel(c0), wa(wrefrel(c0), wsymrel(c0)))))
  sylibr(wa(wss(cres(cid, cdm(c0)), c0), wrel(c0)), wrefrel(c0), wa(wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), c0), wrel(c0)))
  anim1i(wss(cres(cid, cdm(c0)), c0), wrel(c0), wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), c0))
  ax-mp(wi(wss(cres(cid, cdm(c0)), c0), wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), c0)), wss(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), cres(cid, cdm(c0))))
  inxpssres(cid, cdm(c0), crn(c0))
  sstr2(cin(cid, cxp(cdm(c0), crn(c0))), cres(cid, cdm(c0)), c0)
  dfrefrel2(c0)
  bitr4i(wa(wa(wss(cres(cid, cdm(c0)), c0), wrel(c0)), wa(wrefrel(c0), wsymrel(c0))), wa(wrefrel(c0), wa(wrefrel(c0), wsymrel(c0))), wa(wrefrel(c0), wa(wa(wss(cres(cid, cdm(c0)), c0), wrel(c0)), wsymrel(c0))))
  an12(wa(wss(cres(cid, cdm(c0)), c0), wrel(c0)), wrefrel(c0), wsymrel(c0))
  anbi2i(wrefrel(c0), wa(wrefrel(c0), wsymrel(c0)), wa(wa(wss(cres(cid, cdm(c0)), c0), wrel(c0)), wsymrel(c0)))
  3bitr4i(wa(wrefrel(c0), wsymrel(c0)), wa(wa(wss(cres(cid, cdm(c0)), c0), wrel(c0)), wsymrel(c0)), wa(wa(wss(cres(cid, cdm(c0)), c0), wss(ccnv(c0), c0)), wrel(c0)), wa(wa(wss(cres(cid, cdm(c0)), c0), wrel(c0)), wa(wss(ccnv(c0), c0), wrel(c0))))
  anandir(wss(cres(cid, cdm(c0)), c0), wss(ccnv(c0), c0), wrel(c0))
  refsymrel2(c0)
  anbi2i(wa(wss(cres(cid, cdm(c0)), c0), wrel(c0)), wsymrel(c0), wa(wss(ccnv(c0), c0), wrel(c0)))
  dfsymrel2(c0)
  df-redundp(wa(wss(cres(cid, cdm(c0)), c0), wrel(c0)), wrefrel(c0), wa(wrefrel(c0), wsymrel(c0)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm refrelredund4(class c0) {
  ⊢ redund(((= |` dom(c0))⊆ c0 ∧ Rel(c0)), RefRel(c0),(RefRel(c0)∧ SymRel(c0)))
} = {
  mpbir2an(redund(((= |` dom(c0))⊆ c0 ∧ Rel(c0)), RefRel(c0),(RefRel(c0)∧ SymRel(c0))), (((= |` dom(c0))⊆ c0 ∧ Rel(c0))→ RefRel(c0)), ((((= |` dom(c0))⊆ c0 ∧ Rel(c0))∧(RefRel(c0)∧ SymRel(c0)))↔(RefRel(c0)∧(RefRel(c0)∧ SymRel(c0)))))
  sylibr(((= |` dom(c0))⊆ c0 ∧ Rel(c0)), RefRel(c0), ((= ⋂(dom(c0)× ran(c0)))⊆ c0 ∧ Rel(c0)))
  anim1i((= |` dom(c0))⊆ c0, Rel(c0), (= ⋂(dom(c0)× ran(c0)))⊆ c0)
  ax-mp(((= |` dom(c0))⊆ c0 →(= ⋂(dom(c0)× ran(c0)))⊆ c0), (= ⋂(dom(c0)× ran(c0)))⊆(= |` dom(c0)))
  inxpssres(cid, dom(c0), ran(c0))
  sstr2((= ⋂(dom(c0)× ran(c0))), (= |` dom(c0)), c0)
  dfrefrel2(c0)
  bitr4i((((= |` dom(c0))⊆ c0 ∧ Rel(c0))∧(RefRel(c0)∧ SymRel(c0))), (RefRel(c0)∧(RefRel(c0)∧ SymRel(c0))), (RefRel(c0)∧(((= |` dom(c0))⊆ c0 ∧ Rel(c0))∧ SymRel(c0))))
  an12(((= |` dom(c0))⊆ c0 ∧ Rel(c0)), RefRel(c0), SymRel(c0))
  anbi2i(RefRel(c0), (RefRel(c0)∧ SymRel(c0)), (((= |` dom(c0))⊆ c0 ∧ Rel(c0))∧ SymRel(c0)))
  3bitr4i((RefRel(c0)∧ SymRel(c0)), (((= |` dom(c0))⊆ c0 ∧ Rel(c0))∧ SymRel(c0)), (((= |` dom(c0))⊆ c0 ∧ `' c0 ⊆ c0)∧ Rel(c0)), (((= |` dom(c0))⊆ c0 ∧ Rel(c0))∧(`' c0 ⊆ c0 ∧ Rel(c0))))
  anandir((= |` dom(c0))⊆ c0, `' c0 ⊆ c0, Rel(c0))
  refsymrel2(c0)
  anbi2i(((= |` dom(c0))⊆ c0 ∧ Rel(c0)), SymRel(c0), (`' c0 ⊆ c0 ∧ Rel(c0)))
  dfsymrel2(c0)
  df-redundp(((= |` dom(c0))⊆ c0 ∧ Rel(c0)), RefRel(c0), (RefRel(c0)∧ SymRel(c0)))
}

blocks.name: refrelredund2
blocks.content: The naive version of the definition of reflexive relation is redundant with respect to reflexive relation (see ~ dfrefrel2 ) in equivalence relation. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 25-Oct-2022.)

blocks.name: refrelredund3
blocks.content: The naive version of the definition of reflexive relation ` ( A. x e. dom R x R x /\ Rel R ) ` is redundant with respect to reflexive relation (see ~ dfrefrel3 ) in equivalence relation. (Contributed by Peter Mazsa, 25-Oct-2022.)
